definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
lit. the dog that bites does not show its fangs (idiom)/fig. You can't tell the really dangerous enemy from his external appearance.
pinyin: yao3 ren2 gou3 'r bu4 lu4 chi3

definition: lit. the dog that bites doesn't show its teeth (idiom)/fig. the most sinister of people can look quite harmless
pinyin: yao3 ren2 de5 gou3 bu4 lou4 chi3

sentences.english: The most prestigious should be "usual broad Bodhisattva" and the depositary of Buddhist texts.
sentences.chinese: 最負盛名的應該是“露齒菩薩”和藏經閣。

sentences.english: The captured robber grinned at the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 被逮的強盜對警察露齒獰笑。

sentences.english: "He was very strong, huge, " says Vermaelen with a grin.
sentences.chinese: “他非常強壯，高大，”費爾馬倫露齒一笑說。

sentences.english: Those slippery strands of linguine won't stand a chance against this toothy server.
sentences.chinese: 滑絲的扁意這些立場不會對這種露齒的服務器的機會。

sentences.english: You've gone quite mangy, cat, but your grin's a comfort.
sentences.chinese: 你看起來十分骯髒，貓，但你的露齒微笑是一種安慰。

sentences.english: Jojo grinned, and wagged his finger. 'Better than that.
sentences.chinese: 喬仔露齒而笑，搖搖他的手指。

sentences.english: The waiterss grinned at us as we walked in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我們走進餐廳的時候，女待者對我們露齒一笑。

sentences.english: He gave his familiar, twisted grin .
sentences.chinese: 他露出了熟悉的撇嘴露齒的笑容。

sentences.english: It made its intended audience laugh and show their teeth.
sentences.chinese: 它使自己的目標觀衆露齒大笑了。

sentences.english: This time, he comes out of the silence with a slight grin.
sentences.chinese: 這時，他走出沉默露齒而笑。

sentences.english: He grinned as he pocketed the coin.
sentences.chinese: 當他把錢幣裝入口袋時，露齒而笑。

sentences.english: The prisoner's swollen mouth widened in a grin;
sentences.chinese: 囚徒紅腫的嘴脣翕動了一下，露齒一笑。

sentences.english: "You ought to see my kids. " He grinned.
sentences.chinese: “你應該去看看我的孩子”他露齒而笑。

sentences.english: The waitress ginned at us as we walked in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我們走進餐廳的時候，女侍者對我們露齒一笑。

sentences.english: The interior was printed on a toothy off-white paper that contrasts beautifully with the stark white cover.
sentences.chinese: 內陸則印在露齒白色紙張對比鮮明的白色精美的封面。

definition: bell made of copper or bronze
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
see 櫻桃小嘴|樱桃小嘴[ying1 tao2 xiao3 zui3]
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
